message:
hello guys
anyone tried GitLab ?

it's totally free for personal or community (host on your server)
and it's support private or public repositories 

personal edition advantege:
================
-Unlimited repositories
-Unlimited private collaborators
-10GB disk space per project (including Git LFS)
-Unlimited total disk space
-Completely free, no credit card required

community edition:
==============
-support 25,000 users on one server or a highly available active/active cluster
story: Mohammed Ezzat shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Code, test, and deploy together with GitLab open source git repo management software
caption: about.gitlab.com
description: Code, test & deploy with GitLab. Everyone can contribute!

data.message:
yes, we migrated all our repos from BitBucket to GitLab at a startup I work at.
I just think that BitBucket has a slightly better UI, but that's subjective.

If you'll use it just to manage your repos then it's fine but if you'll depend on it for ticketing and following up on progress then it's definitely a bad option and I would consider other tools first.
We use it at my college for students to submit homework and work on group projects. It's nice being able to have our own private hosted version that we can customize.
I am using it for my private repos. GitLab is used by something like 100,000 organizations, lately got 20 million dollars fund and have ambitious goals for the future. I highly recommend it.
I'm using it fr personal private projects
I am using it, it is lovely for both public and private repos
Yes, I just started to use it and it works fine. The main difference from  Github that you can create a private repository for free.
I use gitlab local and leanlab.io kanban containers

We have our own instance at work for managing some private repos/binaries!! 
If you want private repos/git just use bitbucket until it doesn't fit you anymore.
يستحق الذكر بردة https://gogs.io/ ... كنا عملنا منه fork وضفنا ميزات كتير كانت اتأخرت في ال project واستخدمناه backend مع gitlab في مشروع قبل
